description.narrative: (i) Increased access to housing finance: KMRC, through its role as a mortgage liquidity and refinance facility, is expected to expand access to longer-term funding for housing finance, giving commercial mortgage lenders the ability to on-lend for longer tenors at a fixed rate. (ii) Increased affordability of housing finance: Longer loan tenors at which Primary Mortgage Lenders can extend to borrowing customers will lower monthly mortgage payments, thus lowering the income required to buy a house. (iii) Financial integration: The Project is expected to contribute substantially to financially integrating housing finance with Kenya's debt capital markets, allowing more effective intermediation of longer-term capital from savers (local institutional investors) to corporate borrowers in the housing sector.

Kenya Mortgage Refinance Company ('KMRC') is a greenfield entity established in April 2018 with the purpose of providing long-term funding to Primary Mortgage Lenders ('PMLs') to develop the affordable housing segment in Kenya and increase access to affordable housing finance. KMRC received its operating license in September 2020. IFC will serve as an anchor investor in KMRC's first Medium-Term Note ('MTN') bond program of up to KES 10.5bn (~US$93mn) by purchasing up to 40% of the bonds. The bond proceeds will be used to increase the availability of affordable housing finance in Kenya. The project is expected to be supported by the IDA19 IFC-MIGA Private Sector Window Local Currency Facility ('IDA-PSW LCF') as described in the Blended Finance Section.
